abstractText: A modern manuscript of the Ratnamālāvadāna, a collection of avadānas belonging to the cycle of king Aśoka and the monk Upagupta. The title given in the manuscript is Ratnamālāvadānakathā (see in the Excerpts under Final rubrics). Although the last avadāna bears the title Pretikāvadāna, it does not seem to correspond to the text of the story with the same title found in the editio princeps (Takahata 1954; this manuscript has not been used by Takahata for his edition).
